page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The landscape is undulating ranging from 50-101m. above sea level. The river{Teviot}flows N.E. through the area. The{Oxnam Water}flows into it from the South. The main road crossing the area is the{A698 Kelso- {Jedburgh}road. The land is arable and there are five main farms,{Mosstower, {Wester Wooden, Ploughlands, Crailing {Tofts and Kirkmains.}They fatten some sheep and beef cattle but mainly grow cereal crops, and some fodder crops. There are small areas of cultivated woodland and two small Lochs, Whinny, Knowe in the N.W., Wooden in the S.E. {Eckford Village}comprises of 17 houses situated at the East edge of the area. {Crailing}Village has 11 houses and is in the West of the area. There are several others scattered about the area. Both villages have their own Church
